Articles.Content: Eeloo makes me want a 1000000x time warp *yawn*
I think he means that getting to Eeloo takes a long time. But yeah, far away things tend to take a while to get to. Be glad we have our current timewarp.

I tend not to visit outer planets anymore because I'm so impatient. Last I counted, a Jool travel took six minutes at max time warp. A next-level TW setting would be nice, yes.

Also makes waiting for phase angles a pain in the butt.

I've been playing for almost a year and I've hardly left Kerbin's SOI, never visited dres, Moho or Eeloo.

I don't know what this has to do with anything.

I've been playing for almost a year and I've hardly left Kerbin's SOI, never visited dres, Moho or Eeloo.

I don't know what this has to do with anything.

Then why post?

Solution: install Kerbal Alarm Clock. Set it to warn you when it's time to do injection burn, plane change, whatever. And then switch to different craft and do another mission. And yes, these looong waits are PITA. Once i had to wait for about 400 days coasting slowly from Dres to Jool. Don't ask I had fuel left, Jool was in perfect position to catch encounter with minimal fuel usage and the rest is history (read as: Bob is orbiting Bop now, trying to find a way to land near certain dead cephalopode)
